page.title: 14VILLAGE CHANGES
page.content: Butleigh and Baltonsborough formed part of the estate of Glastonbury Abbey until the Dissolution. After this time Butleigh remained in the family of the Squire whereas Baltonsborough was divided into small owner occupied farms. Barton St.David was, from Domesday times, sublet into small farms and now appears as a ribbon development along the roads. In both Baltonsborough and Butleigh the villages were centred around the Church and then expanded. The villages have changed during the second half of the twentieth century from self_sufficient, agricultural communities to largely dormitory villages with considerable house building from the 1960's.
